content:
• Wednesday, March 15, 2017
  • SYNC

    Synacor's Q4 2016, outlook largely at or below expectations

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $34.9M (+7.6% Y/Y, $0.28M below estimates), EPS -$0.10 (in line), net loss $3.1M (vs. $0.4M net loss Y/Y), adjusted EBITDA $1.2M (vs. $2.9M Y/Y), cash and cash equivalents $14.3M (vs. $15M Q/Q), cash generated by operating activities $1.5M
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue $26M-$28M (consensus $30.98M), net loss $6.2M-$7.5M, adjusted EBITDA -$3M to -$4M
    • FY 2017 projections – revenue $160M-$170M (consensus $165.66M), net loss $2.8M-$8M, adjusted EBITDA $6M-$10M
    • After hours –  (NASDAQ:SYNC) $3.24, +3.02%
    • Press release / conference call / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 6:23 PM
  • JBL

    Jabil Circuit -4% despite above-consensus Q2 2017, in-line outlook

    • Q2 2017 results – revenue $4.44B (+0.9% Y/Y, $70M above estimates), EPS $0.48 ($0.02 above estimates), core operating income $152.2M
    • Q3 2017 projections – revenue $4.25B-$4.55B (consensus $4.4B), EPS $0.19-$0.39 (consensus $0.29), core operating income $90M-$130M, Diversified Manufacturing Services revenue +9% Y/Y, Electronics Manufacturing Services revenue -1% Y/Y
    • After hours – (NYSE:JBL) $25.90
    • Press release / conference call / earnings slides / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM

  • ORCL

    Oracle +3.4%; Q3 2017 cloud performance headlines, dividend raised

    • Q3 2017 results – revenue $9.2B (+2.1% Y/Y, $60M below estimates), EPS $0.69 ($0.07 above estimates), operating income $3.9B (+3%), operating margin 43%, net income $2.9B (+6%), short-term deferred revenues $7.4B (+7%), trailing twelve-month operating cash flow $13.5B
    • Revenue highlights – cloud software as a service (SaaS) and platform as a service (PaaS) revenues $1B (+73%), total cloud revenues $1.2B (+62%), total cloud and on-premise software revenues $7.4B (+4%)
    • Other developments – Quarterly cash dividend of $0.19 declared (+27%) payable April 26 to shareholders of record April 12.
    • After hours – (NYSE:ORCL) $44.50
    • Press release / conference call / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • TSLA

    Tesla to raise $1.15B with new offerings

    • Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) announces a $250M offering of common stock and $750M of convertible senior notes due in 2022.
    • The company grants the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional 15% of each offering.
    • Elon Musk will purchase $25M of common stock.
    • The aggregate gross proceeds of the offerings is expected to be approximately $1.15B.
    • Tesla says it intends to use the proceeds to strengthen its balance sheet and further reduce any risks associated with the rapid scaling of its business amid the Model 3 ramp up.
    • TSLA +2.95% AH to $263.33.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 317 Comments
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharmaceutical beats by $0.02

    • Catalyst Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:CPRX): Q4 EPS of -$0.05 beats by $0.02.
    • Press Release
    • Shares +5.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 4 Comments
  • EQC

    Equity Commonwealth boosts buyback

    • Alongside announcement of the annual meeting to take place on June 20, Equity Commonwealth (NYSE:EQC) adds $150M to its buyback program for the next 12 months.
    • Since the company began buying back stock in 2015, it's repurchased 5.9M shares for $156.9M.
    • Shares +1.2% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • WSM

    Bottom line beat for Williams-Sonoma

    • Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM) trades higher after besting profit estimates with its Q4 report.
    • Comparable brand revenue was up 0.9% Y/Y during the quarter, led by a 6.5% gain for West Elm and a 1.4% rise at its namesake chain.
    • Operating margin fell 40 bps to 13.6% of sales amid a higher mix of e-commerce sales (51.1% vs .49.9% a year ago).
    • The company expects Q1 revenue of $1.085B to $1.12B and EPS of $0.45 to $0.50.
    • Previously: Williams-Sonoma beats by $0.04, misses on revenue (March 15)
    • WSM +1.62% AH to $48.90 after a 1.26% gain during the regular session.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • GPRO

    GoPro +10.3%; Q1 2017 revenue expected at top end of guidance, FY 2017 profitability target reiterated, restructuring planned

    • Revenue is projected at the high end of $190M-$210M (consensus $200.07M) outlook previously issued.
    • Operating expense reduction of over $200M on a year-over-year comparison is also anticipated, to be realized through a mix of program cost, headcount and open position cuts. Termination of roughly 270 positions is planned, with charges of approximately $10M of restructuring-associated charges expected to be recognized in Q1.
    • GoPro (NASDAQ:GPRO) $8.11 after hours.
    • Analyst/investor call
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 19 Comments

  • Dutch Liberals top Wilders according to exit poll; euro up more than 1%

    • The initial exit polls show the Liberal Party of Prime Minister Mark Rutte taking 31 seats in today's election. That's down from 41 in 2012, but well head of the 19 seats won by the Freedom Party and Geert Wilders.
    • Already nicely higher following the Fed today, the euro adds to gain, now up 1.25% to $1.0734.
    • ETFs: FXE, EUO, ERO, DRR, ULE, EUFX, URR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 5 Comments
  • PEN

    Penumbra launches 1.3M-share equity offering

    • Penumbra (NYSE:PEN) initiates a public offering of 1.3M shares of common stock. Price and terms have yet to be announced. Net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes.
    • Shares are up a fraction after hours, but only on turnover of 400. Today's close was $78.95.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • VIRT

    KCG Holdings up 23% on reported Virtu bid

    • According to the WSJ, Virtu Financial (VIRT -0.9%) has offered more than $18 per share for KCG Holdings (NYSE:KCG), which soared 23% right before the close to $16.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM

  • VLRS

    Global airline stocks take flight

    • Volaris (VLRS +6.7%), Gol Linhas (GOL +9.7%), Copa Holdings (CPA +2.6%), Avianca Holdings (AVH +2%), China Eastern (CEA +7.4%), China Southern (ZNH +7%) and LATAM Airlines (LFL +7.5%) are all higher on some investor enthusiasm that the sector was oversold.
    • The rally coincides with an airline industry conference at which several carriers have updated guidance, including restrained capacity growth.
    • U.S. airlines Hawaiian Holdings (HA +3.7%) and Allegiant Travel (ALGT +3.5%) are also notably higher on the day.
    • Previously: JetBlue issues update at aviation conference (March 15)
    • Previously: United Continental tips guidance in presentation slides (March 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 4 Comments
  • OBE

    Penn West +15% after reporting Q4 results, raising 2017 output guidance

    • Penn West Petroleum (PWE +14.7%) surges ~15% after significantly narrowing its Q4 net loss compared with the year-ago quarter and raising its FY 2017 production forecast.
    • PWE reported a $0.46/share net loss for the period, improving on a $3.20 loss a year ago, with a 25% Y/Y increase in Q4 funds flow to $0.10/share from $0.08 a year ago; the company did not provide Q4 revenue figures.
    • PWE also raised its 2017 production guidance by nearly 11% over its prior outlook, now expecting average production of 30.5K-31.5K boe/day, a 3K boe/day increase over its previous view released in January.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM

  • Brazil parties after Fed hikes rates

    • Modestly higher prior to the Fed move at 2 ET, the Bovespa has zoomed to a 2.2% gain since. Helping are big rallies in commodities as the policy statement, economic projections, and Yellen press conference gave no indication the Fed is considering a speedier than previously planned rate hike cycle.
    • Oil's up 2.3% and copper 1.3%.
    • EWZ +4.1%
    • ETFs: EWZ, BRF, BRZU, EWZS, BZQ, BRAQ, BRAZ, UBR, DBBR, FBZ
    • Previously: Stocks, bonds, gold turn higher after rate hike; dollar moves south (March 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • DRWI

    DragonWave discloses $1.79M registered offering

    • Selling roughly 1.193M shares through an at-the-market registered direct offering and concurrently in private placement, issuing warrants for purchase of approximately 597K shares at a $1.50 per share exercise price, the company anticipates to raise net proceeds of around $1.6M, to be used for general corporate purposes.
    • DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI) $1.45, -24%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • NSPR

    InspireMD almost gets there with "best efforts" equity offering, raises $6.8M; shares slip 6%

    • InspireMD (NSPR -6.1%) closes its "best efforts" public equity offering, selling 1,069,822 shares of Series C Convertible Preferred Stock, 91% of its target of 1,171,875. Investors also received Series B and C warrants.
    • Net proceeds will fund the expansion of sales and marketing activities supporting CGuard and MGuard Prime EPS.
    • Previously: InspireMD down 35% on equity offering (March 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • XCO

    Exco Resources to sell $300M in new debt, issue warrants to buyers

    • Exco Resources (XCO +36.1%) explodes higher after announcing a series of transactions in an attempt to avert bankruptcy that could ultimately put some of its creditors in control of the company; shares resume trading after a halt.
    • The deals include the issuance of $300M of senior secured 1.5 lien notes due March 2022 to a group of investors including Fairfax Financial, Bluescape Resources and Oaktree Capital, and use the proceeds to pay down its credit line and fund operations.
    • The proposed deal would reduce XCO’s debt burden while offering value to creditors at the expense of current shareholders, WSJ reports.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 9 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: NPTN +15%. MVIS +14%. GSIT +12%. RFIL +10%. QBAK +10%.
    • Losers: RUBI -28%. DRWI -21%. ICLD -11%. CCIH -9%. OTC:TNGO -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • IAG

    Gold miners on the move after Fed rate decision

    • Gold miner shares jump after spot gold spiked as much as 1.3% intraday after the Fed raised its benchmark rate and forecast two more rate increases this year as inflation approaches its 2% target.
    • Investors also were focusing on today's Dutch elections, which have been boosting gold's safe-haven appeal; the nationalist party is not seen as likely to gain power, but a strong election performance would fuel worries over a surprise result in upcoming French presidential elections.
    • Spot gold surged 1.3% to $1,214.90/oz. and has since eased back to +0.8% at $1,212.50; silver now +1.2% at $17.13/oz.
    • Among precious metals companies: IAG +12.8%, AU +9.1%, EGO +8.7%, GFI +8.3%, KGC +7.3%, NGD +7.2%, AEM +6.8%, AUY +6.7%, ABX +6.3%, PAAS +6.3%, GG +5.5%, SLW +5.4%, GOLD +4.7%, NEM +4.2%, FNV +3.7%.
    • ETFs: GDX, NUGT, AGQ, GGN, DUST, SIL, USLV, ZSL, GLDX, UGL, DGP, UGLD, GLL, DZZ, SGDM, ASA, DSLV, SLVP, DGL, RING, DBS, DGZ, DGLD, PSAU, TGLDX, USV, UBG, GDXX, GDXS
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 95 Comments
  • NLY

    Roughed-up REITs rally after rate hike

    • The Fed hiked as expected, but maybe unexpected was very little change to the "dots" and the central bank's economic projections. Worried REIT investors may have been pricing in not just today's rate hike, but perhaps three more by year end.
    • The median Fed forecast, however, sees just two more moves in 2017.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield has dipped a full six basis points to 2.54%.
    • IYR +1.4%, VNQ +1.5%
    • Annaly (NLY +1.7%), AGNC Investment (AGNC +1.8%), Two Harbors (TWO +3%), Western Asset (WMC +2.7%), CYS Investments (CYS +3.6%), Realty Income (O +2.6%), Omega Healthcare (OHI +1.8%), HCP (HCP +1.7%), Vereit (VER +2.2%), Gladstone Commercial (GOOD +1.8%), AvalonBay (AVB +2.1%), Aimco (AIV +2.3%), Simon Property (SPG +1.5%), Public Storage (PSA +1%), Government Properties (GOV-OLD +3.4%), Summit Hotel (INN +1.2%), Stag Industrial (STAG +1.8%)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 42 Comments
  • BAC

    Banks head lower following rate hike

    • The major averages, bonds, and gold have all turned higher after the Fed lifted the Fed Funds rate by 25 basis points, but satiated bank bulls might be lightening up just a hair.
    • After all, the "dots" showed the Fed as being no more hawkish than a couple of meetings back when it surprised the world by predicting three rate hikes this year. Inflation and growth expectations were essentially unchanged as well.
    • So while the Fed may have been faster with a rate hike than many expected just a couple of weeks back, it appears the timetable past today remains the same.
    • KBE -0.15%, KRE -0.1%, XLF flat
    • Janet Yellen's press conference is just getting underway.
    • Bank of America (BAC -0.2%), Citigroup (C -0.6%), JPMorgan (JPM +0.3%), Wells Fargo (WFC +0.1%), Goldman Sachs (GS +0.1%), U.S. Bancorp (USB +0.3%), PNC Financial (PNC -0.4%), KeyCorp (KEY +0.2%), Regions Financial (RF), SunTrust (STI -1%), Fifth Third (FITB -0.7%)
    • ETFs: XLF, FAS, FAZ, UYG, VFH, IYF, BTO, IYG, FNCL, SEF, FXO, RYF, FINU, RWW, XLFS, FINZ, JHMF, FAZZ, FNCF
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 123 Comments
  • TPR

    Coach perks up on takover chatter

    • Coach (COH) is up 2.31% as some loose speculation about a takeover from Kering (OTCPK:PPRUF, OTCPK:PPRUY) makes the rounds.
    • Shares of Coach are at their highest level of the year and came within two cents of hitting $40.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 6 Comments

  • Stocks, bonds, gold turn higher after rate hike; dollar moves south

    • The FOMC hiked as expected, but the updated economic projections might be read as dovish - i.e. there was no material increase in inflation or growth expectations, and the "dots" are saying just two more rate hikes this year. Some had speculated, the Fed might move signal something closer to three.
    • The S&P 500 (SPY +0.7%) has added to earlier gains, and the 10-year Treasury yield has shed eight basis points to 2.52%. TLT +1.1%, TBT -2.2%.
    • Gold (GLD +1.2%) has jumped about $10 per ounce, and the dollar (UUP -0.9%) has moved deeper into the red.
    • Janet Yellen's press conference begins at 2:30 ET.
    • Previously: Fed's economic projections largely unchanged (March 15)
    • Previously: FOMC hikes, expects two more boosts this year (March 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 54 Comments
  • GLF

    Gulfmark Offshore fails to make interest payment; shares -40%

    • Gulfmark Offshore (GLF -40.1%) discloses that it will not pay the $13.7M interest payment on its 6.375% senior notes due 2022 by today's due date; shares resume trading after a halt.
    • GLF says it will exercise the 30-day grace period for the payment.
    • Shares had tumbled to all-time lows even before the announcement.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM

    | 2:00 PM | 10 Comments
  • ARCO

    Arcos Dorados jumps to 52-week high after earnings

    • Arcos Dorados (ARCO +13.4%) rallies after Q4 earnings top estimates.
    • Comparable sales were up 16% during the quarter. Outside of Venezuela, comparable sales increased 9%.
    • Higher average check helped to offset flat traffic.
    • Arco says it plans to open another 180 McDonald's restaurants over the next three years.
    • Shares of Arco are at a 52-week high of $7.30.
    • Previously: Arcos Dorados beats by $0.04 (March 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 5 Comments
  • VOXX

    VOXX International breaks higher

    • VOXX International (VOXX +6.4%) trades higher to break over $5 for the first time since January.
    • The stock is only lightly covered on Wall Street, but yesterday SA contributor Austin Lee called out the upside potential.
    • "All the signs point to a significant turnaround in the core business of VOXX," wrote Lee.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • WHR

    Whirpool drops after appliance shipments data released

    • Shares of Whirlpool (WHR -0.8%) head lower after data from the Association of Home Appliance Manufacturers shows a deceleration in U.S. appliance shipments growth to 3.9% in February to 5.71M units.
    • Appliance shipments were up from 6.4% Y/Y in January.
    • Shipments of washers, dryers, dishwashers, refrigerators, freezers, ranges and ovens were only up 1.1% in February.
    • Sources: AHAM and Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 8 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: GLA +16%. WMIH +14%. CBF +8%. RSO +8%. ZAIS +7%.
    • Losers: PN -22%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • TWI

    Titan International -16% on Q4 earnings disappointment

    • Titan International (TWI -16.6%) plunges more than 15% after reporting a sharply wider than expected Q4 loss on roughly flat revenue that also fell short of expectations.
    • TWI had said with its Q3 report that it believed TWI had reached the bottom on revenue, and the company reaffirms this view and that 2017 will demonstrate this; CEO Paul Reitz says he is encouraged by comments from customers concerning its products, especially the LSW wheel and tire line.
    • TWI says Titan Tire Reclamation is progressing in the oil sands, and it expects the unit's operations will add to both sales and EPS; it says it received seven formal bids for its Italtractor ITM undercarriage unit, but has ended the sales process given improvement in the business.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: CERU +41%. CPRX +37%. ARLZ-OLD +18%. EVRI +18%. GLA +17%. MVIS +17%. NPTN +17%. AXAS +15%. WMIH +14%. ARCO +12%.
    • Losers: RUBI -27%. OTC:CNXR -26%. CELP -24%. DRWI -21%. PN -20%. FTD -19%. GV -18%. TWI -16%. NMM -14%. APRI -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • FTD

    FTD Companies -19% after earnings disappoint

    • Shares of FTD Companies (FTD -19.2%) dive after the company misses estimates with its Q4 report.
    • Revenue was flat in the florist segment during the quarter, but fell off in the provide commerce and international segments.
    • Looking ahead, FTD expects revenue to be largely in-line with the $1.12B brought in during 2016. Consolidated EBITDA as a percentage of sales is seen dropping to 8.0% of 8.5% of sales.
    • Previously: FTD Companies EPS of -$3.17 (March 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 2 Comments

    • Losers: NAKD -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • OXY

    Occidental Petro wins second upgrade in two days, this time from BofA

    • Occidental Petroleum (OXY +2.2%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at BofA Merrill Lynch, a day after Credit Suisse hiked its rating.
    • BofA's Doug Leggate says OXY’s “disproportionate underperformance” has left the stock as the only one among its peers to trade below its February 2016 lows, a similar view to Credit Suisse's Edward Westlake, who argued that the stock as well as energy overall are due for a catch-up.
    • OXY shares have slumped ~9.5% YTD and ~5.7% over the past year, while the top energy ETF (XLE +1.2%) is off 7% YTD and is up 13% over the past 12 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 13 Comments
  • HIMX

    Himax Technologies target raised to $7 at Baird

    • Citing meetings with management indicating a more sanguine financial outlook as compared to in January, as well as near- and medium-term growth drivers (TDDI, 3D sensing, AR-associated LCOS), analyst Tristan Gerra recalculates target from $5, though remains unmoved on rating, retaining shares at Neutral.
    • Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX) $8.14, +2.84%.
    • Previously (January 30, 2017): Himax Technologies downgraded to Neutral at Baird; -3.14%
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 67 Comments
  • MSCI

    MSCI: Sale discussions not true; shares give up gains

    • "We are not in discussions with any third party, and we have not received any offer or indication of interest," says MSCI, responding to a report it turned down an offer of $120 per share from S&P Global.
    • Up nearly 10% ahead of the trade halt, shares have returned to just above flat for the session.
    • Previously: MSCI halted from trade amid buyout rumors (March 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 2 Comments
  • NKE

    Nike falls after negative report from Chinese media

    • Nike (NKE -0.7%) swings lower after CCTV News in China accuses the company of consumer rights violations.
    • There's some uncofirmed reports that authorities are inspecting a Nike office in the nation.
    • Previously: Piper Jaffray waiting on Nike (March 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 14 Comments
  • HOG

    Longbow read sends Harley-Davidson higher, Polaris sputters

    • Longbow Research upgrades Harley-Davidson (HOG +2.9%) to Neutral after having the motorcycle seller stuck at Underperform.
    • The investment firm says Q1 checks show Harley dealers clearing out inventory at a strong pace than anticipated. Harley may have taken some market share from Polaris Industries (PII -0.2%), tips analyst David MacGregor.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • MSCI

    MSCI halted from trade amid buyout rumors

    • It was earlier reported that S&P Global had offered $120 per share and been rejected.
    • MSCI +9.8% to $105.76 at the halt, with news pending.
    • Previously: MSCI rejects $120 bid from S&P Global - Evening Standard (March 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • CNXR

    Connecture Q4 miss weighs on shares, down 27%

    • Connecture (OTC:CNXR -26.7%) Q4 results ($M): Revenue: 20.9 (-28.2%) and shy of consensus of $27.3M.
    • Net Loss: (6.2) (-244.2%); Loss/Share: (0.32) (-268.4%); Cash Flow Ops: (24.4) (-51.1%).
    • Company says headwinds from uncertain political status of Affordable Care Act and proposed health plan merger activity impacted results.
    • 2017 Guidance: Revenues: $73M - 78M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM

  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharma's Firdapse shows treatment effect in certain patients with myasthenia gravis; shares jump 14%

    • Catalyst Pharmaceuticals (CPRX +13.7%) perks up on almost a 5x surge in volume in response to its announcement of positive top-line results from an investigator-sponsored study in Italy assessing Firdapse (amifampridine phosphate) for the treatment of patients with myasthenia gravis (MG) with anti-MuSK antibodies, an ultra-rare subpopulation of MG patients.
    • The company says both co-primary efficacy endpoints in the seven-subject study were met: the change from baseline in QMG score and MG-ADL score. Several secondary endpoints were also met.
    • CEO Patrick J. McEnany says, “These data announced today should allow us to accelerate our MuSK-MG program over the coming months, as we expect to consult with our external experts and regulatory agencies on a pivotal clinical development plan. I would like to thank Dr. Mantegazza, his associates at Carlo Besta Neurological Institute, and the patients that participated in this important clinical trial.”
    • Amifampridine enhances neuromuscular transmission by blocking the potassium channel. This causes depolarization of the presynaptic membranes which opens the calcium channel thereby enabling muscle fibers to contract.
    • MG is an autoimmune neuromuscular disorder characterized by varying degrees of weakness of the skeletal muscles.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 9 Comments

  • KOOL

    Cesca reports positive data from small study of platelet rich plasma to treat chronic ulcers; shares ahead 22% premarket

    • Results from a 24-subject study in India assessing the safety and efficacy of autologous platelet rich plasma (PRP) processed with Cesca Therapeutics' (NASDAQ:KOOL) point-of-care platform to treat chronic non-healing ulcers showed a treatment benefit. The data were just published in the Journal of Biomedical Science. 
    • Each patient received a single dose of PRP injections around the wound in conjunction with topical administration of autologous platelet gel. The process was completed within 30 minutes. The mean healing time was 8.2 weeks. All 24 participants experienced healing, with almost 71% (n=17/24) showing a 90% reduction in wound size. No adverse events were observed on the treatment day or during the 24 weeks of follow-up.
    • Interim CEO Dr. Chris Xu says, “This peer-reviewed publication further validates our novel point-of-care platform for rapid cellular based therapies. As we continue to strengthen our team and evaluate Cesca’s clinical pipeline, these additional data points serve as useful litmus tests to determine the most valuable growth opportunities for the company.”
    • Shares are up 22% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM | 3 Comments

  • ENDP

    Endo International gets Ad Comm thumbs down on opioid OPANA ER

    • The vote at the joint meeting of the FDA's Drug Safety and Risk Management Advisory Committee and the Anesthetic and Analgesic Drug Products Advisory Committee over Endo International's (NASDAQ:ENDP) Pharmaceuticals unit's New Drug Application (NDA) seeking abuse-deterrent labeling for opioid medication OPANA ER (oxymorphone HCl) did not turn out in Endo's favor. The members voted 18 - 8 (one abstention) that the benefits of of the pain medication no longer outweigh the risks.
    • OPANA ER was originally approved in 2006 followed by a new formulation in 2012 designed to deter abuse. The data showed the nasal abuse did, indeed, decrease, but rates of intravenous abuse actually increased.
    • The FDA usually follows the recommendations from Advisory Committees, but Endo is hopeful that OPANA ER will remain on the market citing a number of committee members supporting its continued availability albeit with additional regulatory restrictions to mitigate the risks.
    • OPANA ER generated ~$159M in sales last year, representing almost 14% of U.S. branded pharmaceutical sales and ~4% of the Endo's total revenues.
    • Previously: Ad Comm review of Endo's application for abuse-deterrent claim for pain med Opana ER starts today (March 13)
    • Update: Shares are down 4% in early trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 AM | 26 Comments
